greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n lists all the pairs of prime numbers that are equidistant from n, or only n if there is no such pair, as shown below in the example.
comment: If the extended Goldbach conjecture is true, such a pair exists in row n for all n >= 4. - _Nathaniel Johnston_, Apr 18 2011
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: print(1):print(2):print(3):for n from 1 to 15 do for k from 1 to 2*n-1 do if(not k=n and (isprime(k) and isprime(2*n-k)))then print(k):fi:od:od: # _Nathaniel Johnston_, Apr 18 2011
mathematica: Table[n + Union@ Join[#, -#] /. {} -> {n} &@ Select[DeleteCases[n - Prime@ Range[2, PrimePi@ n], 0], AllTrue[n + # {-1, 1}, PrimeQ] &], {n, 20}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 03 2019 *)
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 14 2009, Jan 16 2009
